basics.name: Carlos Astrada
basics.label: Web Developer
basics.summary: An entrepreneur since college, I have achieved success in several ventures. As an entrepreneur and engineer, I learned to wear a lot of hats, becoming well-versed in the various facets of a start-up, from development to management to marketing. I thrive in fast-paced environments with limited resources and feel that I am particularly well-suited to bringing products to life from the idea stage. From a developer standpoint, working across the stack allows me to tackle hard problems efficiently and iterate as quickly as possible on new ideas.

highlights: Built team of developers, marketers, and managers.
Led development of platform from idea stage to launch
Navigated tricky regulatory state landscape
Built team of developers, marketers, and managers.
Led development of platform from idea stage to launch
Navigated tricky regulatory state landscape
Built and led turnaround team
Achieved consistent profit after starting with 50k avg monthly losses
Negotiated multiple contract extensions with NASCAR for the Official NASCAR Members Club Property
Launched successful wizard-of-oz marketing campaign to test MVP ideas.
Developed and filed successful patent application
Led initial marketing research to develop MVP approach with Lean Startup methodologies.
Built and led developer team in Europe, US, and South America
Led initiative to build and optimize membership platform technology
Built a consulting firm specializing in Magento, Wordpress, and Drupal ecommerce development.
Built team of 27 engineers in 6 countries
Developed processes and methodologies to operate distributed team successfully
Successful exit in 2011
Developed IT-based research projects for the Center for Equity and Excellence in Education (CEEE) while pursuing my graduate studies.
Worked with CSS, SOAP, ASP, and VBScript back when all that was cutting-edge!

publications.name: Systems and Methods for Providing User-specific Product Results Based on Financial Assessment
publications.publisher: The United States Patent and Trademark Office
publications.summary: A patent for systems and methods to test-drive a product or service and provide user-specific results that includes a look-back period, a forward projection, or both.

references.name: Jon-Paul Da Prato
references.reference: Carlos embodies that rare blend of extremely driven and highly conscientious that one rarely encounters in another human being. In title and position, we were peers, and Carlos went out of his way to make me feel that I was justified to consider myself his equal, but at the same time, because he is a consummate professional and extremely competent, I always found myself motivated to go above and beyond in order to live up to the standard that he sets for himself and to warrant the profound faith he has in me. Carlos is a leader. He is a model of excellence, and he is truly one-of-a-kind! If you ever have a chance to work with him, do yourself a favor and make it a reality. You will thank me later for the advice.

references.name: Duke Goulden
references.reference: Carlos has a knack for tackling difficult subjects, teaching others, and is a natural leader. I would strongly recommend Carlos for a software engineering position.

references.name: Scott Tivey
references.reference:
Carlos  brings a wealth of technical prowess & professioalism to his role as SVP of Technology. You won't find anyone who is at the forefront of the tecnological revolution and more importantly, understands exactly how to deploy those best practices to benefit his organizations bottom line performance. He does this all with keeping both long & short term goals in sight, as well as a proactive foresight into how technology and data can be leveraged optimally.

Carlos comes highly recommended as a true professional in his field and I look forward to working with him wherever he is.
